metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10841 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
glusterfs is vulnerable to privilege escalation on gluster server nodes. An authenticated gluster client via TLS could use gluster cli with --remote-host command to add it self to trusted storage pool and perform privileged gluster operations like adding other machines to trusted storage pool, start, stop, and delete volumes. It was discovered that GlusterFS incorrectly handled user permissions. An authenticated attacker could possibly use this to add himself to trusted storage pool and performing privileged operations on volumes.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 4.1.2-1
glusterfs-common - 4.1.2-1
glusterfs-server - 4.1.2-1
libgfapi0 - 4.1.2-1
libgfchangelog0 - 4.1.2-1
libgfrpc0 - 4.1.2-1
libgfxdr0 - 4.1.2-1
libglusterfs0 - 4.1.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2-1').
